alert.note: Alert for Laurel; McCreary; Pulaski; Wayne (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 7:13PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Wayne, southwestern Laurel, southern Pulaski and northeastern McCreary Counties through 745 PM EDT... At 712 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Faubush to Bent. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Dykes, Bent and Grade around 720 PM EDT. Mount Victory around 725 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Monticello, Betsey, Huxley, Kidder, Quinton, Gregory and Delta. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
